14.  Fraud Detection and Prevention Policy  
Soliton values integrity, honesty, and fairness in everyone, from top to bottom. The Company encourages 
openness to prevent malpractice or any cover -up of malpractic e and creates a positive work environment 
where employees have positive feelings about the Company itself and do not feel abused, threatened, or 
ignored.   
This policy has been framed and adopted to provide a system for preventing and detecting fraud, repo rting 
any fraud detected or suspected and fair dealing of matters pertaining to fraud. It aims to provide clear 
guidance to the employees and others dealing with the Company, forbidding them from getting involved in 
any fraudulent activity and the action t o be taken by them when they suspect any fraudulent activity.  
SCOPE  
Soliton is committed to creating and supporting a workplace culture that promotes fair and just ethical 
standards as set out within the Soliton Code of Conduct. Fraud and corruption are incompatible with this 
culture and present a risk to achieving Soliton ’s goal and vision.  
We are committed to preventing, identifying and addressing all acts of fraud and corruption in Soliton. To 
achieve this, we will raise awareness of fraud and corruption risks and implement” preventative” controls 
designed to reduce the  opportunity to commit fraudulent and corrupt acts and “reactive controls designed 
to report, detect and investigate potential fraud and misconduct.  
All individuals regardless of position, title, or tenure are expected to remain vigilant and are responsib le for 
preventing, detecting fraud and report any suspicious fraudulent activity.

DEFINITION OF FRAUD   
Fraud is a false representation or concealment of a material fact  or any other illegal act committed 
intentionally to cause wrongful gains to self or others and /or wrongful loss to others/Company.

ACTIONS CONSTITUTING FRAUD  
The terms fraud or suspected fraud refers to but not limited to: -  
• Forgery or alteration o f any document or account belonging to the Company   
• Forgery or alteration of a cheque, bank draft, or any other financial instrument, financial document 
and personal claims, etc.   
• Misappropriation of funds, securities, office networks, supplies, or other assets, etc.   
• Willful suppression of facts/ deception in matters of appointments, placements, tender committee 
recommendations, entity and project appraisal, submission of reports, etc. as a result of which a 
wrongful gain(s) is made to one and /or w rongful loss(s) is caused to the others.   
 • Utilizing Company funds for personal purposes.   
• Authorizing or receiving payments for goods not supplied or services not rendered.   
• Destruction, disposition, removal of records or any other assets of the Company wi th an ulterior 
motive to manipulate and misrepresent the facts so as to create suspicion/ suppression/ cheating 
as a result of which objective assessment/ decision would not be arrived at.   
• Impropriety In the handling or reporting of money or financial tra nsactions.   
• Profiteering as a result of insider knowledge of company activities.   
• Disclosing confidential and proprietary information to outside parties.   
• Accepting or seeking anything of material value from contractors, vendors, lenders, borrowers and 
persons providing services/ materials to the company in contravention of Soliton’s core values & 
principles and applicable governing law and jurisdiction.   
• Any similar or related inappropriate conduct.

FRAUD PREVENTION  
The Management shall ensure detect ion and prevention of fraud by establishing procedures, checks and 
controls to prevent fraud and detect fraud as and when it occurs.   
In addition to that, the Management shall be responsible to –  
• Educate employees with the types of improprieties that might occur in their area,   
• Create a culture whereby employees are encouraged to report any fraud or suspected fraud which 
comes to their knowledge, without any fear of victimization,   
• Promote employ ee awareness of ethical principles followed by the Company   
• Include reference to recruitment and screening of new staff, an effective appraisal system and exit 
interviews in the HR policies.  
• The purchasing policy is reviewed every 18 months to ensure it has necessary controls.

FRAUD INVESTIGATION  
• Where reasonable suspicion that fraud has taken place, the Company shall investigate the matter 
thoroughly using recognized and legitimate investigative techniques.  
• All investigations shall be carried o ut objectively and confidentially, and independently of the line 
management for the area in which the fraud has occurred or is suspected.  
• In the normal course of events, we would look to hand over the investigation to the police, or other 
authorities, as soon as practical.  
• In certain cases, third -party investigators may be employed in order to gather sufficient evidence 
to hand the case over to the proper authorities. Responsibility for the management of third parties' 
rests with the Manager – People Team , who will take steps to ensure the investigation is conducted 
in an appropriate manner.  
• Where employees are involved in a fraud against the company, whether actual or attempted, they 
will be subject to the company’s disciplinary procedures, which may res ult in dismissal.  
• The Company will seek to prosecute anyone who commits fraud and will seek to recover its assets 
through legal means.  
• The code of conduct adhered to by all investigators will include considerations of all relating 
Legislation.  
• Lessons learnt will be shared across the company as soon as possible after an investigation is 
concluded.

REPORTING OF FRAUD:  
• Any employee (full time, part time or employees appointed onadhoc /temporary/contract basis), and 
person/s involved in business transactions with Soliton Technologies as soon as he / she comes to 
know of any fraud or suspected fraud or any other fraudulent activity must report such incident(s). 
Such reporting shall be se nt in writing to feedback@solitontech.com .  
• In case the reporter is not willing to furnish a written statement of fraud but is in a position to give 
sequential and specific transaction of fraud/suspected fraud, then the “Nodal officer” (People Team 
- Manag er) receiving the information should record such details in writing as narrated by the 
reporter and also maintain the details about the identity of the official / employee /other person 
reporting such incident.   
• Reports can be made in confidence and the p erson to whom the fraud or suspected fraud has been 
reported must maintain the confidentiality with respect to the reporter and such matter should under 
no circumstances be discussed with any unauthorised person.  
• All reports of fraud or suspected fraud sh all be handled with utmost speed and shall be coordinated 
by the “Nodal officer”.  
• The input received about any suspected fraud shall ensure that all relevant records documents and 
other evidence is being immediately taken into custody and being protected from being tampered 
with, destroyed or removed by suspected perpetrators of fraud or by any other official under his/her 
influence.  
Managers should inform the Managing Director if there are indications that an external organisation 
(such as a contractor o r client) may be trying to defraud the company or the employees carrying 
out their duties.   
• They should also inform the Managing Director if they suspect their employees may be involved in 
fraudulent activity, impropriety or dishonest conduct.

INVEST IGATION PROCEDURE:  
(i) The “Nodal Officer” shall, refer the details of the Emergency handling committee, for further appropriate 
investigation and needful action.  
(iii) After completion of the investigation, due & appropriate action, which could include administrative action, 
disciplinary action, civil or criminal action or closure of the matter (if it is proved that fraud is not committed 
etc.) depending upon the outcome of the investigation shall be undertaken under the relevant rules of 
Soliton.  
(iv) Emergency handling committee shal l apprise “Nodal Officer” of the results of the investigation 
undertaken by them. There shall be constant coordination maintained between the two.  
(v) The Criminal Proceedings may be initiated by the “Nodal Officer”, after obtaining approval of Managing 
Direc tor to lodge First Information Report (FIR) with the concerned Police Authorities, in case Contractor is 
found to be involved in fraudulent practices.
15.  IT Policy

Broadband Policy [Applicable for India Solitons]   
The following types of So litons are eligible to avail an allowance towards a domestic broadband internet 
connection:  
a) Solitons who regularly conference with customers/onsite during non -working hours.  
b) Solitons who are approved for 'Part Time Work Mode' for a specified duration.   
 c) Solitons who require a broadband line at home for official purposes, but do not fall under the first two 
categories (at the discretion of the concerned Department Head)  
d) All Solitons who are eligible, as per the above criteria, will receive an allowance from Soliton towards 
internet usage.  
e) IT team recommends for minimum of 4 MBPS for audio conference and 8 MBPS for remote session as 
a minimum criteria to consider before o pting for internet  
f) The amount of allowance is dependent on the ISP and the city in which the connection is required. 
Solitons are advised to opt for ISP considering support, performance, and availability.  
g) It is important to have the required bandwidth so  as to not compromise our productivity or the experience 
of the customer. Please contact the IT department to obtain the latest information on the recommended 
internet service.

TI Embassy Related [Applicable for India Solitons]   
Solitons working in any of the TI Embassies should strictly follow the guidelines specified below, that have 
been mandated by TI IT & Security team. Failing to comply with these guidelines will have serious 
implications on our business with TI and for the concerned individual.  
a) Do not connect any removable media (USB, CDs, iPods, mobile phones etc.) to systems connected to 
the TI network  
b) Only TI approved equipment is allowed in the TI areas  
c) Camera use is not allowed in the TI secured area. Do not carry cameras into the embassy and refrain 
from taking pictures using the camera in mobile phones.  
d) Leave all personal computers / laptops or other portable devices (e.g. PDA’s etc.) outside the TI 
Embassy area.  
e) Do not use any other mechanism to connect to the internet unless approved by TI IT Security other 
than via TI web proxy.  
f) Do not use any email/chat clients, remote desktop software that is not approved by TI for doing TI 
business.  
g) Do not connect any external storage devices to TI provided Laptop/desktop  unless approved by TI IT 
Security.  
h) Do not enable the wireless card on the desktop/laptop when connected to the TI network unless 
approved by TI IT Security.  
i) Screen lock [Ctrl -Alt-Delete Enter]  the computer when our leave our work area.  
j) Do not attempt to access restricted areas within the  embassy, such as server room (unless we are 
authorized by TI to do so) and Fire Exit (except in case of emergency).  
k) If we are unsure about the guidelines for any situation not discussed above, please contact the Soliton 
IT team before taking any action.

Others  
Laptops given to an Soliton are the property of the company. All Solitons are required to adhere to the 
following policy regarding company laptops:  
a) Soliton will take all reasonable measures to ensure the physical and digital secu rity of the laptop 
including:  
• Locking the laptop in a secure location when it is not in use  
• Changing the password as often as required by employer  
• Ensuring  that Company provided Anti -virus, Firewall, or Encryption software is functioning   
 b) Installing  torrent clients is strictly prohibited. The company may face loss of reputation and possible legal 
action through this type of misuse.

Laptop buyback   
Solitons who have been using the company laptop for more than 4 years, would be given the option t o 
purchase the same, at a nominal, predetermined cost. Such laptops would be sold as -is, with no warranty. 
Solitons who wish to purchase would need to return the laptop to IT for formatting.

Security Guidelines for Computer, E -mail, and Internet Usage  
a) All critical data is to be considered confidential.  
b) Always maintain confidentiality of the login password and keep changing this at regular intervals  
c) Use of any pirated software is strictly pr ohibited. Read freeware and shareware End User License 
Agreements before installing to make sure they are free for commercial use.  
d) Be wise on the Web.  
e) Always access the internet from behind a firewall as it is always safe to block unauthorized access. 
A firewall acts like a security layer between the PC and the internet.

Unacceptable use of the internet/computers   
a) Solitons are expected to use the Internet responsibly and productively. Internet access is limited to 
job-related activities only and all personal downloads should be restricted to after work hours when 
no critical business activities are in progress. It is the personal responsibility of each Soliton to 
monitor this on his/her own.  
b) Do not use office computers to perpetrate any form of fraud , and/or software, film, or music piracy.  
c) Avoid downloading, copying, or pirating software and electronic files that are copyrighted or without 
authorization.  
d) Do not hack into unauthorized torrent websites. This is strictly prohibited. The company may fa ce 
loss of reputation and possible legal action through these types of misuse.  
e) Mobile phones need to be connected to the WiFi dedicated for mobile phones. This is because the 
WiFi router specs are determined based on the number of devices that will be con nected to it and 
if more connections are made to it from the many mobile phones that  are in the office, the 
performance of the work laptops and computers connected to the work WiFi connections will be 
compromised.

16.  Guidelines on Mobile Phone (u sage charges) reimbursement   
[Applicable for US Solitons]  
This guideline is applicable for Solitons who are working with Soliton Technologies, Inc (US Solitons).

Eligibility    
a) Solitons can claim the usage charges incurred for the business activity on monthly basis. Both call 
and data charges can be claim ed.   
b) Reimbursement will be made on the claimed amount subject to a max limit of $50 per month.   
c) If the bill is less than $50, the actual amount can be claimed.

Guidelines    
a) The claim is applicable only for one number/connection.   
b) All claims for r eimbursement need to be submitted within the same financial year, atleast 10 working 
days prior to the end of Financial year.   
c) The bill should have the claiming person’s number listed.

Claim procedure:    
a) Soliton submits the reimbursement form and attach a copy of the bill to People team’s PIC 
(person -in charge).    
b) Soliton declares the amount spent for business activities in the claim form, Reimbursements will 
be provided to Solitons through the payroll in  the next available pay period once the 
reimbursement claim form is submitted.

17. Separation Policy  
Notice Period   
Every Soliton is expected to discuss any plan relating to resignation well in advance with the Project 
Manager and the People Manager and serve the appropriate notice period, as mentioned in the offer letter.  
We don’t have buy back option available to Solitons by default.  
If a Soliton wishes to get relieved earlier, s/he must have a discussion with the team in which s/he is part 
of, and it is important to get the team to approve it. This is because the team continues to be responsible 
for the commitments made to the customer.  If the Soliton, who wishes to get relieved earlier, is a solo 
member of any Project, the Project Manager(s) and their counterparts on the Customer’s side are to be 
considered as the tea m members.   
Team’s decision will be final and People Team / Leadership team will not be involved in the decision making 
or approval process.

Recommendation Letter   
Recommendation Letters will be issued by the immediate managers to Solitons completing 3 years at 
Soliton. No Recommendation Letter will be issued to Solitons who are relieved before completing 3 years 
at Soliton or who have been let go for performance rea sons.

Exit Formalities  
Separation initiation  - A Soliton can initiate the separation by sending the resignation letter to the 
reporting person via email. Reporting person acknowledges it and responds with a confirmation on the 
last working day and loops in the People team to initiate the separation formalities.  
Separation Clearance – All company properly must be returned on or before the Soliton’s last day of work.   
 “Separation Clearance form” has to be signed off by all the concerned teams confirming “No -Dues” before the 
last day of work.  
Exit Interview – An exit interview will be conducted by the HR Manager on the Soliton’s last day of work.

Full & Final settlement   
 All types of leave entitlement for the on -going year will be re -calculated on pro -rata basis (number.of 
months completed until exit date) and the excess leaves taken beyond the eligibility will be marked as 
loss of pay (LOP).   
 Annual leave or Privilege leave balance will be encashed (to a max of 30 days) as per Soliton Leave 
policy. No other category of leaves will be eligible for encashment.  
 If there is a shortfall of notice period, the salary in lieu of the remaining days will  be deducted from the 
final dues.  
 Statutory payments like PF, ESI, Income Tax, Professional tax will be deducted as per the applicable 
regulations of the Central/State Govt.  
 A Statement of Settlement will be handed over to the Soliton, within 7 working d ays from the last day 
of work.

Step by step procedure on Flexi-pay Benefit plan (FBP) declaration.pdf

__data__.text:
Step by step procedure on Flexi -pay Benefit plan (FBP) declaration   
1. Login to the GreytHR portal.  
2. Click on the “Salary” tab on the left side and choose “FBP declaration”.  
3. Click on the edit button in the FBP declaration window.  
4. Tick on the components that we wish to opt and enter the amount in the “Preferences” cell 
within the Max limit and click on “Submit” after declaring the preferred components.
